document.title: Configuring the Microsoft Word Spelling Checker
document.para: If you are using the Word Spelling Checker or the Word Spelling Checker 2.0 in TagEditor, you will need to configure the spelling checker options from within Microsoft Word.
Note: The Word Spelling Checker is an earlier version of the Word Spelling Checker 2.0.

list.item: In Microsoft Word, on the Tools menu, click Options to display the Options dialog box.
In the Options dialog box, click the Spelling & Grammar tab.
In the Spelling group box, choose the options that you want for the spelling checker:
Select the Check Spelling as you type check box for automatic correction of misspellings as you type.
Select Always suggest corrections to have Microsoft Word suggest corrections to misspellings.
Select Suggest from main dictionary only if you do not want Word to suggest spellings from any open Custom dictionaries.
Select Ignore words in UPPERCASE to skip words containing uppercase characters only, for example, acronyms.
Select Ignore Internet and file addresses if you do not want Word to check Internet addresses, file names or email addresses.
